Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Aurein 3.3 (natural AMPs; XXA, UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals; BBBh2o)
Sequence Information.Source: Southern bell frogLitoria aureaorLitoria raniformis, Australia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against B.cereus (MIC >100 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC >100 ug/ml), L. lactis (MIC 12 ug/ml), L.innocua (MIC >100 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 100 ug/ml), P. multocida (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 50 ug/ml), and S. uberis (MIC 25 ug/ml) (provided by Chunfeng Wang).Chemical modification: C-terminal NH2.Sequence analysis: Found in multiple species. Uniprot: P82396.Activity: Cryo-EM studies found aurein 3.3 can form amyloid fibril structure (Amyloid AMPs).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Updated 9/2017; 7/2021; 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Rozek T, Wegener KL, Bowie JH, Olver IN, Carver JA, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.2000, Australia
Literature Information.Title: The antibiotic and anticancer active aurein peptides from the australian bell frogs Litoria aurea and Litoria raniformis the solution structure of aurein 1.2.
